## Welcome to the OA Lab!

We provide advice and support for researchers who wish to publish in Diamond Open Access (DOA), independently of commercial publishers: as editorial board members, editorial teams, or authors of academic journals.

::: {.btn-group .d-flex .justify-content-center role="group" aria-label="Role navigation"}
<a href="#for-editorial-board-members" class="btn btn-outline-primary">For Editorial Board Members</a> <a href="#for-editorial-teams" class="btn btn-outline-primary">For Editorial Teams</a> <a href="#for-authors" class="btn btn-outline-primary">For Authors</a>
:::

## For Editorial Board Members

Together with you we design:

-   new OA journals
-   innovative features for your OA journal
-   strategies for the further development of existing OA journals

We support you in:

-   deciding on formats (HTML, PDF, XML), publishing platforms (e.g. [OJS](https://pkp.sfu.ca/software/ojs/)), hosting solutions, and software
-   transforming existing print or online journals to OA/DOA (Flipping)
-   including your OA journal in relevant databases and metric-based indices (e.g. [DOAJ](https://doaj.org/), [Scopus](https://www.scopus.com/sources.uri?RN_AG_Sourced_400000654), [Web of Science Core Collection](https://mjl.clarivate.com/home), [EBSCO](https://www.ebsco.com/), [ERIH PLUS](https://kanalregister.hkdir.no/publiseringskanaler/erihplus/), [WorldCat](https://search.worldcat.org/de), etc.)
-   deciding on suitable OA licenses ([Creative Commons](https://creativecommons.org/share-your-work/cclicenses/))

For questions about:

-   [funding options for open access publications](https://www.ub.unibe.ch/services/open_science/open_access/index_eng.html)
-   [open access requirements of funding organisations](https://www.ub.unibe.ch/services/open_science/open_access/index_eng.html#pane1224714) (SNF)

please contact the Open Science Team of the University Library of Bern UB: [openaccess\@ub.unibe.ch](mailto:openaccess@ub.unibe.ch)

## For Editorial Teams

We share our expertise on the following topics:

-   designing OA-journal workflows
-   editorial process: guidelines for peer review, proofreading, stylesheet…
-   production process: formatting, typesetting, proofreading, publication…
-   best practices: workflow in OJS, image management (image rights and image editing)
-   communication with authors and editorial board, time management…
-   plagiarism check: software and handling of plagiarism
-   marketing strategies (social media).

We offer:

-   regular consultation and training for editorial teams of OA journals
-   assistance in optimizing editorial workflows

For questions about:

-   technical infrastructure for scholar-led open access journal projects such as [BOP Serials](https://bop.unibe.ch/), [Open Journal Systems](https://pkp.sfu.ca/software/ojs/) (OJS), [SciFlow Publish](https://sciflow.net/en/sciflow-publish), and [identifiers](https://www.ub.unibe.ch/services/open_science/identifiers/index_eng.html) (DOI, ISBN, ISSN, GND)

please contact the Open Science Team of the University Library of Bern UB: [openaccess\@ub.unibe.ch](mailto:openaccess@ub.unibe.ch)

## For Authors

We advise you on:

-   image management (image rights and image editing)
-   communication with museums, libraries, archives, etc.
-   communication with editorial teams of OA journals
-   legal questions (copyright)

We offer tips on:

-   innovative presentation of image material
-   embedding multimedia features into texts (video, audio, etc.)

For questions about:

-   [funding options for open access publications](https://www.ub.unibe.ch/services/open_science/open_access/index_eng.html)
-   [open access requirements of research funding institutions](https://www.ub.unibe.ch/services/open_science/open_access/index_eng.html#pane1224714)
-   [Article Processing Charges (APC) and Book Processing Charges (BPC)](https://www.ub.unibe.ch/service/open_science/dienstleistungen/index_ger.html#collapse_pane780347)

please contact the Open Science Team at University Library of Bern UB: [openaccess\@ub.unibe.ch](mailto:openaccess@ub.unibe.ch)

## About Us

The OA Lab is a service of Digital Humanities at the University of Bern. Katharina Böhmer (director) and Alessandra Fedrigo (collaborator) played a key role in establishing the successful art history Diamond OA journal [*21: Inquiries into Art, History, and the Visual*](https://21-inquiries.eu/en) as editors, are experts in the field of OA publishing for academic journals and specialists in digital image management. They are happy to share their in-depth editorial expertise and practical experience with everyone interested.

We look forward to hearing from you!
